title: willi9974
author: willi9974
created_time: January 03, 2023, 05:27:45 PMLast edit: January 13, 2023, 11:30:10 AM by willi9974
content: Today Happy Birthday Bitcoin on 3 January A great gift for all Bitcoin fans for the desk or mounting on the wall or put it with the other stuff in the Crypto showcase area of your home. Genesis blockA genesis block is the first block of a block chain. Modern versions of Bitcoin number it as block 0, though very early versions counted it as block 1. The genesis block is almost always hardcoded into the software of the applications that utilize its block chain. It is a special case in that it does not reference a previous block, and for Bitcoin and almost all of its derivatives, it produces an unspendable subsidy.OrderGenesis block stainless steel plate 120x120x8mm weight approx. 900g --> $49Genesis block stainless steel plate 100x100x6mm weight approx. 450g --> $39Genesis block stainless steel plate 100x100x4mm weight approx. 310g --> $37 Shipping depending on country --> need your address Per PM Payment in BTC and ETHFor a order send me a PM an have a look in my other offers to save shipping cost.Stainless steel Bitcoin Recovery Seed Platehttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5323755.040mm x 3mm 30g Bitcoin Coin (loadable and customizable coin)https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5382457.0Source: https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Genesis_blockBest regards,Willi

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Happy birthday, first Bitcoin block.Flawless timing, and I like this a lot, looks really cool.10x10 cm seems a little bit tiny for putting it up on display, still debating if I should get one or not.Is it possible to create a bigger 15x15 or maybe even 20x20 version?I would want one, given still reasonably priced and as a limited edition (maybe 21?). If you add a personal touch / design, this could sell quite well here. Just my guess and thoughts.Maybe some other collectors agree / have other suggestions?

comments.body: I also would be interested in one if you made them a bit bigger

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: the funny thing about this address is how some block explorers do not show the initial 50 BTC for example, mempool.space and blockstream shows its balance as ‎18.55982773 BTC while btc.com, blockchair and blockchain.com shows it as 68.56982773 BTC

comments.author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.body: Can you make something like this but on thinner sheets of metal or precious metals?

comments.author: willi9974
comments.body: Quote from: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES on August 10, 2023, 09:16:10 PMCan you make something like this but on thinner sheets of metal or precious metals?This is not a problem on thinner stainless steel. Copper is impossible to process with my laser. Brass and Aluminum works, too. What material specifically did you have in mind?Best regards,Willi

comments.author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.created_time: August 20, 2023, 07:22:55 PMLast edit: August 20, 2023, 10:50:14 PM by CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.body: Quote from: willi9974 on August 11, 2023, 06:59:38 AMQuote from: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES on August 10, 2023, 09:16:10 PMCan you make something like this but on thinner sheets of metal or precious metals?This is not a problem on thinner stainless steel. Copper is impossible to process with my laser. Brass and Aluminum works, too. What material specifically did you have in mind?Best regards,WilliI would have never seen this response, if i didn't search it out. The oldest known book in existence is made with gold pages (500BC time frame), silver ones exist as well from the same time period, such as King Darius's tomb. This doesn't included clay tablets. With that said I'm looking for an epic way to store public addresses for long periods of time. Engraving them into silver sheets might be a great way to do it and make a treasure in and of itself. We can call it "The Book of Keys" I can't use steel or anything that rust or corrodes easily, especially in humid wet environments or submerged under water for long periods of time. We all know how often we lose items in "boating" accidents in the Caribbean haha! I would like to know the size of any micro engraving you can produce. List will be of thousands of different denominations of physical bitcoins/ altcoins public addresses. Probably should include the bitcoin whitepaper as well. I have piles of silver spoons and forks just laying around. I can have them made into small sheets of metal for engraving. Similarly to the pictures provided. Would also need holes drilled to hold the pages together with "D" rings. So the purity of the sheets will be anywhere from .800 - .950 purity of Silver. LMK options availablecT

comments.author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.body: I just remembered I have a few hundred of these small 999FS tablets of pure silver laying around. look at the size and let me know how small you can engrave. Its okay if you have to use a 45x loop to read. It would make it all the more fun to read.    25mmx45mmx2mm

comments.author: willi9974
comments.body: You can really use stainless steel / V2A that material has no corrosion and cost not so much.That cards are business cards that can marked /graved with a laser and you can write a really small size text. Here are a example for that cards.Best regards,Willi

comments.author: Timelord2067
comments.body: The artist Klimt used platinum in his artworks to simulate silver given silver tarnishes over time.  Might make for a very expensive back up.
